Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: To create a process tree that models this complex hospital patient management scenario, we need to break down the process step by step and translate the given complex process description into a process tree structure.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: "The patient begins their journey by Arriving (A) at the hospital reception. Upon arrival, the patient must complete a Registration (RG) ..." This part of the process is a sequence: -> (A, RG, IA).

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Following registration and intake assessment, we recognize another sequence: Triage Interview (TI) and Triage Classification (TC). This part is an additional sequence: -> (IA, TI, TC).

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Based on the triage classification, there is an exclusive decision between diagnostic tests (Comprehensive ECG or Full Blood Panel). This requires XOR (CE, FBP).

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: From the abnormal results loop, we generalize that the loop structure should consist of Specialist Consultation, a treatment choice (Targeted Medication or Specialized Physical Therapy), and Follow-Up Diagnostic Test (Follow-Up ECG or Follow-Up Blood Analysis).

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The loop is logically defined as * (-> (SC, X(TM, SPT), X(FCE, FBA)), tau), where tau represents the exit condition for normal results.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: After the loop, we identify true concurrency tasks (Advanced Imaging and Nutritional Counseling) modeled as + (AI, NC).

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The final sequence includes Follow-up Appointment Scheduling (FAS), Detailed Discharge Instructions (DDI), and a last parallel set of administrative tasks: + (BL, ICP, MRF).

Name: Validation - PE
Text: The overall process sequence is reviewed for logical correctness and matches the task requirements. Each stage of the process tree ensures validity with provided operators and conditions.
